page.title: 04The use of Woodland
page.content: The area has some estate woodland and most notably the parkland- type associated with English country houses at Turvey House and Turvey Abbey.The woodland at Snelson,mainly oaks and ash are for commercial purposes and coppiced every 15 years.Thet also provide gamecover for shooting.In the last 35 years 84,000 conifers have been planted.Of particular interest is an area of 8000 Bat Willows.Those planted at the edge of the plantation come to maturity in 16 years as their roots have access to water,whilst those in the middle take 22-23 years.When they are cut their trunks are just thick enough to reach around.They are sent to a firm in Essex who also have a nursery of sets for replanting.The timber is made into cricket bats and the branches are used to make artificial limbs.
